DataElement.preferredName: Prior Vaccination Administered Vaccination Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the status of an individual's vaccination for Shingles.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the prior vaccination administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Suspensions of killed or attentuated microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, or rickettsiae), or of antigenic proteins derived from them, administered for the prevention, amelioration, or treatment of infectious diseases or cancer.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.
Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether an individual has received a vaccination._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.value: No, but I might get vaccinated for shingles in the future

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Maybe take Herpes Zoster Vaccine in Future
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question._An indication that something is possible, but not uncertain._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject._A common dermal and neurologic disorder caused by reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus that has remained dormant within dorsal root ganglia, often for decades, after the patient's initial exposure to the virus in the form of varicella (chickenpox). It is characterized by severe neuralgic pain along the distribution of the affected nerve and crops of clustered vesicles over the area._Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response._On the inside; contained in._A time that is yet to come.

A common dermal and neurologic disorder caused by reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus that has remained dormant within dorsal root ganglia, often for decades, after the patient's initial exposure to the virus in the form of varicella (chickenpox). It is characterized by severe neuralgic pain along the distribution of the affected nerve and crops of clustered vesicles over the area.
Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response.
On the inside; contained in.
A time that is yet to come.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.16.20 mc

PermissibleValues.value: I got shingles before I could get vaccinated

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Varicella Zoster Infection Prior Receive Vaccination
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A highly contagious viral infection caused by the varicella zoster virus. Clinically, it may be manifested as shingles or chicken pox._Earlier in time or order._To take, accept, or get something offered._Administration of vaccines to stimulate the host's immune response. This includes any preparation intended for active immunological prophylaxis or treatment.

Concepts.definition: A highly contagious viral infection caused by the varicella zoster virus. Clinically, it may be manifested as shingles or chicken pox.
Earlier in time or order.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Administration of vaccines to stimulate the host's immune response. This includes any preparation intended for active immunological prophylaxis or treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Active immunization where vaccine is administered for therapeutic or preventive purposes. This can include administration of immunopotentiating agents such as BCG vaccine and Corynebacterium parvum as well as biological response modifiers such as interferons, interleukins, and colony-stimulating factors in order to directly stimulate the immune system.
